review_title: At a complete loss as to why leadership has gone completely blind?
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
Benefits are so cheap compared to other industries and businesses. The staff and faculty really are spoiled on the employee share of the cost. 
The campus is beautiful and for the age of it, you can tell that on the shoestring budget that they are given, maintenance really tries hard to make it amazing. 
For the most part, the staff try so hard. The tool we are given are terrible, but each person tries to come together and figure out work arounds everyday. Makes the work 10 times harder, but as a team, the staff members are great.
cons:
Over the past year and a half, the college has really suffered a downturn. The attrition level has been insane. Losing a huge number of administrative staff, which is the backbone of any organization, is straight up a leadership issue. That's business 101. You NEED to be looking at your cabinet members, president and VP's. Staff do not feel heard or seen. If the pandemic has taught people anything, it is that they do not have to tolerate bad environments where they feel neglected and abused. However, this is lending itself to the loss of a treasure, which is the college itself. Leadership is on the verge of collapsing this great little college and ruining a historical staple in the Salt Lake Valley. Unless there is a serious internal look at themselves and how they treat their staff, they will not have any staff left and without the staff that they treat like 2nd class citizens, they will not be able to service the students and faculty to keep the college open. 
Compensation is low for the workload that is expected because they will not invest in updated software to do the job correctly.

review_title: Great college to work for--salary and growth opportunities are limited
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: You'll be working with very talented faculty and staff. While there are some egos, most of the people are truly great and care about the students. Staff opportunities are limited and pay is low--but if that isn't important to you, you'll love it there.
cons: Few growth opportunities, low staff pay, and in recent years the college has struggled with student recruitment which has led to lay offs. It seems like they can't get their budget right.

review_title: Great place to work! Love the people and the environment!
job_title: Maintenance Technician in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: I love workin at Westminster due to the environment and the people. You couldn’t ask for a prettier place to work day to day, and the schooling, health, and retirement benefits are awesome.
cons:
The only downsides to my job is that I feel like I am routinely asked to do menial/trivial assignments that have never been considered maintenance responsibilities anywhere else I’ve worked. Like moving furniture and boxes for professors. 

My only other gripe is that the position is a bit underpaid for the scope of skills and responsibility required for the job, and a raise seems hard if not impossible to come by for staff employees.

review_title: Great Community with a Few Drawbacks
job_title: Assistant Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The community of Westminster is supportive, friendly, and allows employees to have pride in their job. The time off, benefits, and retirement packages are great. Additionally, tuition assistance for the employees and their families is a great perk.
cons: The pay can be low, probably because of the great benefits. Additionally, the culture tends to treat you like family - which has its drawbacks. Employees are often asked to take on more and more work without compensation or commiserate titles because it is the "duty to the college." Additionally, incompetent employees are seldom let go. Rather they are moved to other positions or departments rather than enforcing expectations that they should be able to perform in their position.

job_title: Mathematics Tutor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The start center gave my number to a lot of students, and I was able to meet with them at my own convenience.  Most of the students were very grateful, and would not take more than two hours of time.  It was a great way to make a little extra money while doing school.
cons: Finals week always drew in the most students who were stressing about students.  Be prepared to be bombarded with people wanting help as you approach finals.

review_title: Great place to work, depending on your department
job_title: IT Support Position in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Great retirement bennefit and time off. Great people to work with for the most part
cons: You will never move any where in this company.  Componsation is based on Title.  No incentive to work hard and put in the extra effort.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: It's a beautiful campus located in the heart of Sugarhouse. Flexible work hours. If you're lucky enough to work with students, you'll be impressed. The students here are amazing.
cons:
The workload is unreasonably heavy. Hard work goes unnoticed and unappreciated. Resources are sparse.  There is no transparency about what departments get funding and/or resources and why. Departments have different goals and often work against each other. 

The senior leadership has created a fearful and toxic environment.  Their lack of concern for student and staff wellbeing is alarming and dehumanizing.  Decisions made by senior leadership do not reflect Westminster's mission and values. 

Furthermore, diversity is not respected by the senior leadership. The only steps taken to make the campus more inclusive are marketing schemes to attract more students and boost enrollment.

job_title: Intramural Supervisor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Small Classes, great professors, close to outdoor activities, different opportunities to connect with people, great library and resources
cons: One of the downsides is the costly tuition. Another downside is the cafeteria that isn't the best I have ever seen

job_title: Fund Analyst in Salt Lake City, UT
